The entire proposal consists only of the title and the link to the official IOG dRep sign-up form.

I’m not going to give it a score of 1, because by making the official sign-up form more readily available to those participating in Catalyst and by writing a title that encourages people to sign as a dRep this proposal actually may have had some impact on the diversity of dReps and the willingness and ability of people to sign up - exactly what this challenge is about.
f6_assessments.q1:
I won’t evaluate if the proposal is feasible to be implemented because obviously the project has already been implemented by the submission of this proposal. The proposal is the project.

Other assessors might choose to see this proposal as a troll or a joke, but we can also think of it as a piece of performance art, created with the intend of making a statement and having an impact on the dRep process. Besides that it can also reveal things about the Catalyst process itself, about how it reacts to the proposal in all of its stages - PAs, vPAs, voters and ultimately IOG.

The requested budget for the proposal is $100. There are 3 co-proposers, meaning that in the eventuality this proposal gets funded the budget will most likely be split between them at $33.33/person. I’ll leave it up to the voters to decide if it’s worth paying that amount from the treasury for this effort, that’s why I’m neutral on this section, and my grade reflects that.
